sources.title: Seven Acts (2000)
sources.description: Seven Acts (2000) Synopsis Four young men: an English teacher whose relationship with his girlfriend is going to break, because of his financial problems, a clerck whose brother with a incurable disease makes him many troubles, a philosophy student whose poorly life is dominated by an ironic nihilism and a young driver whoes car is in pawn with an old usuerer, all commit theft, each for his own reason. In the first step they kidnap the old usuerer but he refuses to give them money and they kill him unintentionally. So they are obliged to escape from the city and then confront with many problems in which the teacher's girlfriend acts an important role ... Seven Acts - Haft parde (2000) Directed by: Farzad Motamen Date of birth: 10 August 1957, Tehran, Iran Writing credits: Saeed Aghighi Music by: Nusrat Fateh Alikhan Country: Iran Language: Farsi Color: Color Runtime: 100 minutes Released: 2001 Genre: Drama

metadata.Plot: Four youngsters decide to solve their financial problems by stealing. They bring guns and gather and steal from a shop and run away but the police chase them and find them.
metadata.Actors: Golshifteh Farahani, Mehdi Ahmadi, Fariborz Arabnia
